intro: Achillea umbellata subsp. pauciloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved yarrow, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It features basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate, with a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped umbels, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties have made it a subject of interest in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
